item.title: Econ 616: Problem Set 1
item.description:
Problem 1

Let \(\phi (z) \equiv 1 - \phi_1 z - \phi_2 z^2\). What we need to show is the solution of the equation \(\phi ( z) =0\) lies outside of unit circle. Let \(z_1\) and \(z_2\) be the solutions of \(\phi (z) =0\).

  • Case 1: Suppose \(\phi _{1}^{2}+4\phi _{2}\leq 0\). Then we have either \(z_{1}=z_{2}\) or that \(z_{1}\) and \(z_{2}\) are complex numbers and conjugate of each other. In any case the norm of the solution is given by \(\sqrt{\left\vert \frac{1}{\phi _{2}}\right\vert }\). Hence the condition is \(|\phi_{2}|<1\).

item.title: Econ 6016: Problem Set 1
item.description:
*Due in class on Tuesday, February 18th.

Problem 1

Consider the AR(2) process

\begin{eqnarray} y_t = \phi_1 y_{t-1} + \phi_2 y_{t-2} + \epsilon_t. \end{eqnarray}

  1. Show that a necessary condition for stationarity is that the coefficients lie inside the triangle \[ \phi_1 + \phi_2 < 1, \quad \phi_2 - \phi_1 < 1, \quad \mbox{and} \; \phi_2 > -1. \]

  2. Now re-parameterize the AR(2) model in terms of partial autocorrelations \(\psi_1\) and \(\psi_2\): \[ \phi_1 = \psi_1(1-\psi_2), \quad \phi_2 = \psi_2. \] Show that the AR(2) process is stationary if and only if \(\psi_1 \in (-1,1)\) and \(\psi_2 \in (-1,1)\).
